titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Henenlotter genealogy and property research papers ARC.038
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-22T14:53-0500

did.unittitle: Thomas Henenlotter genealogy and property research papers

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Thomas Henenlotter conducted genealogical research on Brooklyn and Queens families in relation to land and property ownership in Brooklyn and Queens.
There is a discrepancy as to the correct spelling of Henenlotter. It has also been spelled Hennenlotter.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: There is a detailed inventory list included in Folder 1 of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Thomas Henenlotter genealogy and property research papers contain genealogical research notes on Brooklyn and Queens families and property ownership research for areas of Brooklyn and Queens, dating from the 1880s through 1951. The research was conducted by Thomas Henenlotter. Included in the collection are notes on property ownership for Newtown, Meadow Lots, Public Park, and Shore Parkway. There are also notes on heirs to property; land deeds in Newtown, Queens County; land surveys of areas in Brooklyn, Corona, Queens and Jamaica, Queens; abstracts of titles, issued from Surrogate's Court, for property in Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, and Rockland County; and genealogical notes on families and property ownership for the Budd, Hoke, Remsen, Meserole, Schuchardt, and Reed families among others.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Thomas Henenlotter genealogy and property research papers, ARC.038, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
This collection combines the accessions 1977.228 and 1980.015.
